result.name: $49.95 Value Pack
result.description:
If you’re serious about saving money on electricity, then our weekly Value Pack is what you’re looking for. About a week’s worth of power for the average user at price that’s very hard to beat.

With the colder weather you'll be using a bit more power, so we've bumped up the size of the weekly value pack, but kept the same lean unit price.

There’s no catch, but you are limited to one pack per customer per week, so if you want to save, you’ll need to top up regularly. Go for it now and save.

Who is Standard Power?
Standard Power is backed by Powershop. It is the name we use for our budget house brand electricity because it is the same bulk standard electricity, just better deals.

result.name: Green Power Top Up
result.description: Do you choose your electricity company based on how they generate their power? Unfortunately the electrical power from the grid that you actually use in your home comes from a mix of sources that you cannot control. Only The Green Power Company buys carbon credits to help offset the greenhouse gas emissions from electricity generated on your behalf. The sources of electricity on the grid range from the giant Manapouri and other hydro dams, geothermal power at Wairakei, through to gas and coal fired power, including the thermal power station at Huntly. Around one third of electricity in NZ is generated from fossil fueled thermal power stations. Source MED Even the geothermal fields in Wairakei are not above reproach, as they result in so called fugitive greenhouse gas emissions. Every household in New Zealand that is on the grid relies on all of these power stations, although the mix of electricity source you use depends on where you live and changes through the seasons. Each of these power sources has a different contribution to New Zealand’s carbon emissions, with established hydro dams showing essentially zero emissions and coal and gas fired plants the most. The MED release quarterly updates on the electricity generation emission factor and it is this emission factor we use in our calculations to determine the amount of carbon we need to offset for each unit of Green Power you purchase (see http://www.med.govt.nz/upload/67175/NZEQ_Sepetmber08_EditorsVersion.pdf). Currently, the emissions factor to determine the greenhouse gas equivalent of electricity derived emissions from generation is 0.18 (ktCO2e/GWh). The greenhouse gas emissions per electricity unit are therefore 0.18kg/unit. For every Green Power unit you purchase The Green Power Company will purchase verified voluntary carbon units to offset 0.18kg of carbon. As voluntary carbon units offset carbon by the tonne and individual household electricity emissions per month are likely to be in kilograms of carbon, we will aggregate the emissions from all our customers and reconcile them the month following to the nearest tonne. Aggregated emissions that are less than one tonne will be rolled over to the following month. The verified voluntary carbon units purchased by us will be retired in our Voluntary Carbon Standard Registry account. You can check the PowerKiwi Limited (The Green Power Company) Registry account on the TZ1 Registry. About The Green Power Company The Green Power Company product is offered through Powershop, which is web based, paper free, safe and far more fun than the traditional power companies. The Green Power Company is a product from PowerKiwi, an independent NZ owned company. Tips: * Change your default product to Green Power by clicking on the yellow “make this my default product” checkbox above. That way you’ll always be sure to get the only power that truly accounts for emissions. * Find out when your meter reader is coming via text – use My Settings, Alerts * Save petrol by turning your engine off if you will be at a stop light for longer than 10 seconds. source Y! Green

result.name: Crusaders Power Pack
result.description:
The excitement and energy of Super 14 Rugby has now been transformed into ‘Crusaders Power’.  If you are a one-eyed Crusaders supporter and your favourite colours are red and black - this $50.00 Crusaders Power Pack is for you. By purchasing this pack you can support your favourite Super 14 team.  While the Super 14 playing season might have finished, you can still follow your favourite team members as they play for the All Blacks.

Each Crusaders Power Pack is about a week's worth of electricity for an average user in winter.   Don't drop the ball. Grab this red and black deal now.

result.name: Meridian 300
result.description: Choose the Meridian 300 special, and you can purchase up to 300 units of electricity at the great price shown (cents/unit). You’re limited to one Meridian 300 purchase per week, so be in quick while the offer lasts. Wind and water are nature’s carbon free fuels, and Meridian uses them to generate electricity. We’re committed to sustainability, and encourage you to be too. “Meridian 300” is carboNZerocertTM certified electricity. All units of this product used, will be accounted for by Meridian under the rules of the Landcare Research carboNZerocertTM programme. For more information about Meridian, or our carboNZerocertTM certification, visit www.meridianenergy.co.nz.

result.name: $84.90 catch up pack
result.description: Buy in bulk and save. With Flower Power $84.90 value pack you can quickly catch up on power you have used. Restricted to one per week and use any time before the "use by" date above. Make sure though that you use all of your bulk purchased electricity - as all bulk purchases are use it or lose it propositions. Flower Power Flower Power is owned by PowerKiwi, an independent company.

result.name: Tree Power Top Up
result.description: For each 30 units you buy Treepower will plant a tree through Trees for the Future. We have contracted Trees for the Future to plant a tree for every 30 KWh of TreePower that is used. Trees for the Future has been working with communities in Central America, Asia and Africa since 1989, and we are proud to be able to contribute to their work. They work directly with rural communities in countries and locations that need serious help to restore ecological balance. Planting the trees helps the communities in three ways - restoring degrading lands and farms, minimising erosion, and providing forage for animals. The process also involves training local people to care for their own environment. Meanwhile Trees for the Future estimates that each tree will absorb about 50 lb (that's 22 kg) of carbon, though this is not certified, and it will vary depending on the type of tree and the location. If you want to offset the carbon emission impact of your electricity consumption then try our sister product Green Power. About Tree Power Tree Power is a product from PowerKiwi, an independent Kiwi owned company. We have a partnership contract in place with Trees for the Future. We have just launched Tree Power, but will report back on how many trees are planted as we progress.

result.name: Meridian Crimson
result.description: Choose Meridian Crimson and you play a part in protecting New Zealand's native trees. For every unit of Meridian Crimson electricity you buy, Meridian will donate 2 cents to The Project Crimson Trust - a charitable trust that protects and renews Pohutukawa and Rata trees throughout New Zealand. When you choose Crimson power, you're helping our Kiwi Christmas trees keep blooming brilliant red every summer. “Meridian Crimson” is carboNZerocertTM certified electricity. All units of this product used, will be accounted for by Meridian under the rules of the Landcare Research carboNZero programme. For more information about Meridian, or our carboNZero certification, visit www.meridianenergy.co.nz. See www.projectcrimson.org.nz for more on the Trust’s work.

result.name: Flower Power Top Up
result.description: Welcome to Flower Power! Power companies have been keeping us in the dark. Buying power can actually be very simple, quick and fun. Join the Flower Power revolution today and you'll still get electricity from the same source, use the same meter and receive the same professional backup if things go wrong. * Take control, and buy electricity on your own terms * Save money and impress your friends! * 100% safe, online and paper free Join the Flower Power revolution, and top up with Flower Power. About Flower Power Flower Power is a product from PowerKiwi, an independent NZ owned company.
